required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: In Vivo Study of Sucrose and Liquid Oral Pediatric Medicines of Long-term Effect on Dental Biofilm pH
clinical_study.official_title: Avaliação in Vivo do Potencial cariogênico e Erosivo de Bebidas e Medicamentos pediátricos líquidos Intra-orais

brief_summary.textblock: The aims of this study were to determine the sucrose and liquid oral pediatric medicines of long-term effect on dental biofilm pH to evaluate the cariogenic potential in vivo.

detailed_description.textblock: Te study was carried out with 12 subjects that were refrained from brushing their teeth for 28 h and did not eat or drink for at least 3 h prior to each appointment. Dental biofilm pH was measured in the cervical and proximal regions of anterior teeth with beetrode-type microelectrode coupled to a potentiometer. The biofilm was submitted nine paediatric medicines a long term and sucrose (negative control). pH measurements were taken at baseline to determine resting plaque pH and at time interval 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 and 30 minutes.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of group respiratory, nutritional and endocrine pediatric medicines effect on dental biofilm pH
primary_outcome.description: pH was measured in the cervical and proximal regions of anterior teeth dental biofilm with beetrode-type microelectrode coupled to a potentiometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of sucrose antibiotic group and control negative group effect on dental biofilm
secondary_outcome.description: The biofilm was submitted antibiotic group and negative control group. pH measurements were taken at baseline to determine resting plaque pH and at time interval 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 and 30 minutes.

arm_group.description: Application of antibiotic group of pediatric medicines and control group (sucrose 10 %)on dental biofilm.
Application of Nutritional, Respiratory and Endocrine groups medicines pediatric on dental biofilm

intervention.description: Nutritional, respiratory and endocrine group applicated 12 subjects
Application of trhree pediadic medidines of antibiotic group on dental biofilm 12 subjects
